intro: Tovomita jenmanii, commonly known as the African starfruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that resemble starfruits, hence its common name. Tovomita jenmanii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
